abstracts.cdata!:
Although the Irrigation Improvement
            Project aims at alleviating the water diversion, and
            distribution on the agricultural area covered by the Tuban,
            and Zabid wadis, potential environmental impacts include
            degradation of irrigation land, due to water salinity, and
            chemical pollutants, water-logging, erosion and
            sedimentation, in addition to the mining groundwater problem
            from the wadi Zabid. Consequently, health hazards arise,
            resulting from poor quality of drinking water, and low
            levels of hygiene, and sanitation. This Environmental Action
            Plan recognizes the need for coordination with other
            projects in the area, but suggests the project should lead
            in soil, and water management issues, and offers mitigating
            measures for: 1) mining ground-water on irrigation, and
            water supply, emphasizing the need to transfer water
            management responsibilities to the new wadi institutions,
            and to train extension workers, and farmers on water
            management for irrigation. Systemic ground-water monitoring,
            and testing should be undertaken, to be revised further on;
            2) soil erosion, and sedimentation, to be assessed through a
            rigid soil survey, and, a watershed study, to review, and
            formulate watershed management strategies; 3) sand dune, and
            river bank protection, to be selectively supported through
            mechanical, and vegetative control. Sanitation, and potable
            water issues will be addressed through different Bank operations.
